text: The 13th edition of the Ronde van Drenthe, a women's cycling race in the Netherlands, was held on 17 March 2019. Italian Marta Bastianelli won the race in a three-way sprint before Dutch riders Chantal Blaak and Ellen van Dijk. The race started and finished in Hoogeveen, covering eleven cobbled sections and three ascents of the VAM-berg. With a total distance of , it was the longest UCI Women's World Tour race ever. It was the second event of the 2019 UCI Women's World Tour. ==Teams== 20 UCI teams entered the race, as well as a Dutch national team.
